Class UserInterface

java.lang.Object
UserInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class UserInterface extends Object implements ActionListener
Class UserInterface - Implements a simple graphical user interface with a text entry area, a text output area and an optional image.
Version:
1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2023)
Author:
Michael Kolling

  • Constructor Details

    • UserInterface

      public UserInterface(GameEngine pGameEngine)
      Construct a UserInterface. As a parameter, a Game Engine (an object processing and executing the game commands) is needed.
      Parameters:
      pGameEngine - The GameEngine object implementing the game logic.

  • Method Details

    • print

      public void print(String pText)
      Print out some text into the text area.
      Parameters:
      pText - The text to print.

    • println

      public void println(String pText)
      Print out some text into the text area, followed by a line break.
      Parameters:
      pText - The text to print.

    • showImage

      public void showImage(String pImageName)
      Show an image file in the interface.
      Parameters:
      pImageName - The name of the image file to display.

    • enable

      public void enable(boolean pOnOff)
      Enable or disable input in the entry field.
      Parameters:
      pOnOff - If true, enables input; if false, disables input.

    • createGUI

      private void createGUI()
      Set up graphical user interface.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent pE)
      Actionlistener interface for buttons and entry textfield.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      pE - The ActionEvent triggered by the user's interaction.

    • processCommand

      private void processCommand()
      A command has been entered in the entry field. Read the command and do whatever is necessary to process it.
